content.description: Left hand on three finger (one pad) sidepull and right hand on 2-3 finger (one pad) sidepull. Move out to arete and up. Good movement.
content.location: Left of Lawyer

content.description: Start crouched, climb the left side of the slabby face to a top out.
content.location: Slab directly on the trail between The Burbot Bloc and Sugar Bowl.

content.description: Start as for Mizayikaa (right hand side-pull, left hand undercling) and climb left, executing a crux throw to gain the start of Lush. Top out as for lush. Pleasing and sustained movement, but slightly dabby.
content.location: Back-center of the Burbot Bloc, down and right of Lush.

content.description: SDS on the lowest jug, make big moves on more positive edges before topping out
content.location: Just south of Rum Runner's Cove

content.description: One of the best traverse routes on the lakeshore. The scoup traverse sit starts far right and takes the lip of the cave into the original scoup route on the left
content.location: scoup boulder

content.description: SDS in the back of the cave matched on an undercling. Using small crimps work through the steep bulge to into the start of The Scoup. Nice movement, but a bit dabby. Detached blocks are off.
content.location: In the back of the overhang beneath The Scoup

content.description: SDS matched low on the arête. Follow the lip of the boulder, utilizing some poor footholds, before topping out on the far left end.
content.location: The short wall to the right of Mud Shark.

content.description: The low start to Poor Man's Lobster. Start sitting in the hole on two edges. 5 moves, just enough to zap some power, stand between you and the start of Poor Man's Lobster. A sequential, power endurance block that would surely be classic if it weren't so awkwardly dabby. All detached blocks are off!
content.protection: Something super thin like an Organic Blubber Pad would be nice for the start. Otherwise, a pad or two should protect the top.
content.location: In the hole directly beneath Poor Man's Lobster on the Burbot Bloc.

content.description: Start as for Pork Eater but top out early and right using a large ledge.
content.location: A few hundred feet south of The Scoup.

content.description: SDS with right hand on a sloping crimp and left on a three-finger edge. Traverse left into The Butcher using positive edges and nonexistent feet. Rather dabby...
content.location: A few hundred feed south of The Scoup.

climbs.name: Poor Man's Lobster
climbs.fa: Unknown: first recorded ascent on MP Will O

content.description: Start sitting partly in the hole matched on an undercling. Gain the large ledge before trending right and making the powerful crux move to a far away edge and topping out.
content.protection: Excellent Landing, A pad or two
content.location: Leftmost route on the freestanding boulder facing The Lakeshore Overhang

content.description: Start sitting in the hole where "The Poverty Line" starts. Chimney the first half using detached blocks then climb the face to the top. Awkward start in the slot.
content.location: In the hole directly beneath Poor Man's Lobster on the Burbot Bloc.

content.description: Sit start matched on the prominent rail. Balance up the high-angle face to a mantel top out.
content.location: Left end of the west-facing wall 100 yards past the Burbot Bloc

content.description: SDS with right hand on a side-pull deep in the cave and right compressing a large in-cut side-pull. Tension your way to the wave-polished sloper before pulling the bulge and topping out.
content.protection: A pad or two, something thin would be nice.
content.location: Cave-like feature on the far right end of the backside on the Burbot Bloc

content.description: SDS with left hand on an undercling and right on a side-pull edge. Work up the steep face with some fancy foot work before executing the crux throw and topping out on the slab above.
content.location: Center of the backside of the Burbot Bloc (down and right of Lush).

content.description: Start as for Eelpout Low, but cross into an undercling crimp and head left through a few edges before manteling at the lip and topping out.
content.location: Right end of the east face (lakeside) on the Burbot Bloc.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand on a sloper and right hand a horizontal pinch above head height. Gain a couple in-cuts and power over the bulging lip to a mellow top out slab.
content.location: Center of the north face of the Burbot Bloc

content.description: Stand-start with left hand on the arête and right on a small crimp. Establish and toss for the lip. There is potential for a lower start, but it would be much more difficult.
content.location: West face of the boulder adjacent to the Lakeshore Overhang.

content.description: Stand/jump start on the lip at the far right end of the boulder. Traverse left on positive edges and pockets topping out at the other end of the boulder. Excellent holds with thoughtful movement.
content.protection: Two-tiered landing. Two pads and an attentive spotter should feel comfy.
content.location: The lip of the freestanding boulder opposite The Lakeshore Overhang

content.description: Lay-down Start with left hand on the arête and right on a slopey, side-pull crimp. Muster up some body tension as you work through a series of crimps to gain the start of the dead-point. Top out as for Loche.
content.location: Left end of the east (lake side) face of the Burbot Bloc.

content.description: SDS with a small pocket in the left and a slopey pinch for the right. Climb the arête using small edges and blocky pinches. Top out straight over the lip.
content.location: Right arête on the freestanding boulder opposite the Lakeshore Overhang.

content.description: SDS with a left hand side-pull and right hand gaston. Make a powerful move to a stellar quartz pocket before gaining the lip and topping out as for Lota Lota.
content.location: Center face of the Burbot Bloc

content.description: SDS with a side pull in the left and a slopey ledge for the right. Compression on blocky holds leads to an awkward top out.
content.location: This feature lies a hundred yards or so south of The Scoup.

content.description: Climb the center of the tall slab, don't fall
content.location: Obvious slab southeast of the Lakeshore Overhang

content.description: Laydown Start with left hand on an edge and right on a low side-pull. Use some core strength to keep your but off the pads as you gain the start crimper of Eelpout and ride its nice crimps to the top.
content.protection: Two pads or so and a spetter
content.location: Right end of the east (lake side) face of the Burbot Block.

content.description: SDS with a low ledge for the left and an incut edge for the right. Climb Diagonal crimps to the top.
content.protection: A bad barndoor could leave you wet, but there's really only room for a pad
content.location: Lakeside face of the freestanding boulder opposite Lakeshore Overhang.

content.description: Start squating on a low block. Work up big ledges before moving left to a large side-pull feature after which delicate movement on sloping crimps leads to a thoughtful top-out
content.location: The face right of The Scoup, landing may be wet depending on how windy it is.

content.description: SDS with left hand on a small incut and right on a tiny three-finger crimp. Make a powerful move to gain the big holds of Lota Lota and top out.
content.location: In-between Lawyer and Ling Cod.

content.description: SDS with left hand in the seam and right on a side-pull/undercling feature. Head up and slightly left through a series of stellar grips to a thought provoking top out. It's not possible to protect this climb with the current water levels, exercise caution.
content.location: Where the water meets the shore on the west facing outcrop 100 yards past the Burbot Bloc.

content.description: Start as for butcher but climb straight up through huge in-cuts.
content.location: A few hundred feet south of The Scoup

content.description: Start matched in the giant flake/crack as far down at left in the slot cave as you can manage. Traverse left following the crack until it goes vertical. Head up with it and top out. Sustained and sharp.
content.location: Slot Cave in the gully between the Instant Oats slab and Burbot Bloc.

content.description: SDS with right hand on a positive side-pull and left on the sloping ledge. Move left along the ledge before rocking over to grab a very sharp but positive rail and topping out.
content.location: A few hundred feet south of The Scoup

content.description: Link Ling Cod into Lota Lota. The length and movement of this climb make it very enjoyable!
content.protection: Two-tiered landing, 2 pads and a spotter
content.location: Right arête of the freestanding boulder opposite Lakeshore Overhang

content.description: Starts off at a crack near the bottom of boulder, follow this crack up until you make a big move with left hand to a triangular slope, then move right hand to grab vertically flat crack. The left hand then moves left to a large crimp and the right hand moves up to a crimp. Big Left hand move up to a jug and match this hold. From here traverse left grabbing a sloper with the left hand then a crimp with right so you can move the left hand to a pinch and then bump it to a jug. Match this jug and finally there are two more jug holds to top out.
content.protection: 3-4 Pads will cover the whole route with protection.

content.description: SDS with a left hand mini-pinch and a right hand side-pull. Make a huge move to a triangular sloper/pinch (the left hand start hold of lush) before compressing the arête to gain the victory jug and topping out. Detached features are off.
content.protection: One or two pads, but you may have to move some rocks around to keep them above the water.
content.location: The northeast corner of the Burbot Bloc.

content.description: Bouldering along the lake shore south of Rum Runner's Cove. This area has a longer approach and some of the climbs may be difficult to find at first, but the additional effort is quickly rewarded with excellent lines, solitude, and picturesque scenery.
